pageContext.claim: “After decades of flat and falling incomes, wages are rising fast.”
pageContext.analysis: Wage have not been flat. Real wages, adjusted for inflation, have gone up over the last several presidencies, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics: Under Barack Obama, the average weekly earnings for production and nonsupervisory workers went went up 4.2 percent; under George W. Bush, wages increased by 4.2 percent; Under Bill Clinton, wages rose 6.4 percent. And under Trump? The increase has been 2.6 percent.
